intro: Corysanthes arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakensis flame orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, flame-like inflorescences that display vibrant red and orange hues. The plant belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its intricate, fragrant blossoms that attract specific pollinators. Its leaves are broad and glossy, adapted to thrive in the humid, shaded environments of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat destruction, it is considered a threatened species.
